subject: Relationships
title: Digital Boundaries in Relationships
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Digital Boundaries in Relationships.

hook.text: Should partners share phone passwords? 41% of couples do. Half of them later wish they hadn't.

buildup.text: Digital boundaries include screen-time limits during dates, social media privacy, and response expectations.

discovery.text: Couples who discuss and agree on tech boundaries report 30% fewer tech-related conflicts.

twist.text: Demanding full phone access isn't trust â€” it's surveillance. Trust means not needing to check.

climax.text: Digital boundaries aren't walls. They're agreements that protect connection in a world of infinite distraction.

punchline.text: Sharing passwords isn't trust. Not needing to check is.

quiz.question: What do couples who set tech boundaries experience?
